results.title: Postcard from Tunis
results.brief_description: The central theme of ‘Postcard from Tunis’ is writing itself - its histories, its inscriptions and its relevance to the human-computer interface. This is explored in a personal, audiovisual portrait of Tunis, the home of my family-in-law. I designed and programmed the unique interface so that it echoes an actual visit, where you can’t help learning a few Tunisian words and with time, starting to read written Arabic. Although the work was designed for adults, children have shown a strong affinity with it.

results.title: Brother
results.brief_description: The childhood memory of a brother, his cigarette butts, asthma and head lice. An exploration of the simple truths and ironies that make up a life. An iconic Australian film.
results.description: The childhood memory of a brother, his cigarette butts, asthma and head lice. An exploration of the simple truths and ironies that make up a life. An iconic Australian film.

results.title: Catch of the day
results.creator_credit: Sarah Watt, Australian Film Commission and Swinburne Institute of Technology. Film and Television School
results.brief_description: The bright, beautiful and spontaneous ocean is something to wallow in. A young girl plays in the ocean and with the fishes. A dashing surfer rides up on his white steed and declares ‘I’ve come - you’ll never have to chop onions again!’ Jane wakes up from her dream (or was it a nightmare?) Working at the fish market, she endures the sexual innuendo and double entendres from male customers and fellow workers alike. When matters come to a head, she cleverly takes the situation into her own hands and offers a unique solution to unsolicited sexual advances… An impressionistic animation.

results.title: Like drowning
results.brief_description: The story of a little boy’s grief for his mother delicately etched into clay. This simply charming film explores the grief that a young boy, Billy, experiences after losing his mother. All he wants is her back.
results.description: The story of a little boy’s grief for his mother delicately etched into clay. This simply charming film explores the grief that a young boy, Billy, experiences after losing his mother. All he wants is her back.

results.title: Time-lapse footage of decomposing rat
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour, silent
results.brief_description: Remarkable time-lapse sequence depicting the natural decomposition of a dead rat. Produced by Oxford Scientific Films, this footage is as elegant as it is grotesque.

results.title: Cousin
results.brief_description: The childhood remembrance of a cousin, his special arm, pet rocks and shopping trolley. He was born with cerebral palsy. The narrator tells of their antics together as children: their attempts to fly off the chook shed roof, out of control shopping trolley rides as well as being introduced to his many assorted collections of tee shirts, pet rocks and toenails.

results.title: Rapt
results.brief_description:
A virtual body built from Magnetic Resonance Imaging (MRI) scans of the artist’s body. MRI scans map the water content of the body to produce axial slices. These scans were used to create a 3D body accessible on any plane, making it possible to navigate through the body, and to view it internally and externally.

(Special thanks to Ray Scan Imaging and The Childrens’ Hospital Westmead Sydney)

results.title: Blood
results.brief_description:
Travelling through Australia with his film camera, Ivan Sen has visited many Aboriginal communities, from urban to prison to distant-rural. Photographing people in their definitive environments, he has created an installation which is a subtle and deeply moving meditation on skin, landscape, gesture and the many nuances of Aboriginal identities.

The work contains imagery of people who have all shared the same blood. The blood of the Gamilaroi people of Northern NSW.
